title: Building Shelter in Chemical Contaminated Areas
brief: How to construct and position emergency shelter to minimize chemical agent exposure.
steps: Step 1: If possible, move crosswind or upwind to exit contaminated area quickly.
Step 2: Build shelter in a clearing, completely away from all vegetation.
Step 3: Remove all topsoil in the shelter area to decontaminate the ground.
Step 4: Position shelter entrance at 90-degree angle to prevailing wind direction.
Step 5: Keep entrance closed at all times to prevent agent entry.
Step 6: Use extreme caution entering shelter to avoid bringing contamination inside.
warnings: Do not build fires with contaminated wood - smoke will be toxic
Never build shelter in low areas where chemical agents concentrate
Vegetation can harbor and protect chemical agents from breakdown
